'''Benjamin Walker Scodelario-Davis''', better known as '''Benjamin Walker''', is an American actor and stand-up comedian. He portrayed [[High King of the Noldor|High King]] [[Gil-galad]] in the ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power]]'' series by [[Amazon Studios|Amazon]].<ref>{{webcite|author=Joe Otterson|articleurl=http://variety.com/2020/tv/news/lord-of-the-rings-series-amazon-cast-1234845274/|articlename=‘Lord of the Rings' Series at Amazon Adds 20 Actors to Cast|dated=3 December 2020|website=[http://variety.com/ Variety]|accessed=3 December 2020}}</ref>

During the 2024 San Diego Comic Con, Benjamin Walker sang a song in [[Quenya]].<ref>{{webcite|author=The Lord of the Rings on Prime|articleurl=https://x.com/TheRingsofPower/status/1816960907576246471|articlename=A song from Gil-galad himself, Ben Walker.|dated=26 July 2024|website=[https://x.com/ Twitter]|accessed=}}</ref>

==Quotes==
{{quote|I’m glad that people like Gil-galad; I feel honored to wear his crown.|Benjamin Walker, Fandom Wire}}
{{quote|When I was a kid—I have an older brother and he’s an avid reader who’s infinitely more intelligent than I’ll ever be, and the first big-boy book he ever gave me was The Hobbit. He introduced me to The Lord of the Rings and that’s what we’d play in the woods. I have that familial connection. So my gateway was the books. Luckily for us, the foundation of what we’re doing is based on the source material. I basically get paid to read Tolkien. It’s great.|Benjamin Walker, The Daily Beast}}
